DOC.brief_summary: The study investigates the effect of an obturator nerve block on the postoperative pain and opioid consumption after total hip replacement.
DOC.brief_title: Postoperative Analgesia After Elective Hip Surgery - Effect of Obturator Nerve Blockade
DOC.criteria: Patients for primary hip replacement in spinal anesthesia Age >= 18 years American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification score IIII Informed consent Lacking the ability to corporate Lacking the ability to speak danish Planned discharge on the same day of surgery Neuropathy of the lower extremities Contraindications for NonSteroidal AntiInflammatory Drugs (NSAID) Chronic opioid demanding pain Pregnancy Allergy towards one or both investigatory medicinal products Active treatment with amiodarone Active treatment with verapamil Active treatment with corticosteroids
